1: <sup>1</sup> But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.
2: <sup>2</sup> For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
3: <sup>3</sup> For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.
4: <sup>4</sup> But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.
5: <sup>5</sup> Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.
6: <sup>6</sup> Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.
7: <sup>7</sup> For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.
8: <sup>8</sup> But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.
9: <sup>9</sup> For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,
10: <sup>10</sup> Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.
11: <sup>11</sup> Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
12: <sup>12</sup> And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;
13: <sup>13</sup> And to esteem them very highly in love for their work’s sake. And be at peace among yourselves.
14: <sup>14</sup> Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.
15: <sup>15</sup> See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.
18: <sup>18</sup> In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
21: <sup>21</sup> Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.
22: <sup>22</sup> Abstain from all appearance of evil.
23: <sup>23</sup> And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
24: <sup>24</sup> Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
26: <sup>26</sup> Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.
27: <sup>27</sup> I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.
28: <sup>28</sup> The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
